availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p: State City & county of New York ss

I John Bissell having been appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Comissioner to take testimony acknowledgments &c to be used or recorded in that state, do hereby & solemnly affirm that I will well & truly execute & perform all the duties of that office to the best of my ability So help me God.,
subscribed & sworn to before me this 10th day of March 1862

New York 10th March 1862
Hon Jas W Tate Secretary of State &c
Sir

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of a Commission to take testimony acknowledgments &c for your state & herewith forward you to be placed on file the evidence of my compliance with your statute on that subject --
Have the goodness to make to His Excellency the Governor my acknowledgments for the honor thus confered & assure him it is my earnest hope that no act of mine shall induce him to think it misplaced

Very respectfully your
Obt srvt
John Bissell

New York
Oath of Jno. Bissell
Comr. of Deeds
Filed Mar 13 1862
